trans-unit.source: Changes the operation of various AutoIt functions/parameters.

seg-source.mrk: Changes the operation of various AutoIt functions/parameters.

target.mrk: Changes the operation of various AutoIt functions/parameters.

trans-unit.source: The option to change. See Remarks.

[optional] The value to assign to the option. The type and meaning vary by option. See remarks below. If the param is not provided, then the function just returns the value already assigned to the option. The keyword Default can be used for the parameter to reset the option to its default value.

seg-source.mrk: The value to assign to the option.
The type and meaning vary by option.
If the param is not provided, then the function just returns the value already assigned to the option.
The keyword Default can be used for the parameter to reset the option to its default value.

target.mrk: The value to assign to the option.
The type and meaning vary by option.
If the param is not provided, then the function just returns the value already assigned to the option.
The keyword Default can be used for the parameter to reset the option to its default value.

trans-unit.source: the value of the previous setting for the option.

seg-source.mrk: the value of the previous setting for the option.

target.mrk: the value of the previous setting for the option.

trans-unit.source: sets the @error flag to non-zero. Failure will occur if the parameters are invalid (such as an option that does not exist).

seg-source.mrk: Failure will occur if the parameters are invalid (such as an option that does not exist).

target.mrk: Failure will occur if the parameters are invalid (such as an option that does not exist).

trans-unit.source: You may use Opt() as an alternative to AutoItSetOption().

seg-source.mrk: You may use Opt() as an alternative to AutoItSetOption().

target.mrk: You may use Opt() as an alternative to AutoItSetOption().

trans-unit.source: <a id="CaretCoordMode">Sets the way coords are used in the caret functions, either absolute coords or coords relative to the current active window:

trans-unit.source: 2 = relative coords to the client area of the active window

trans-unit.source: <a id="ExpandEnvStrings">Changes how literal strings and % symbols are interpreted. By default strings are treated literally, this option allows you to use %environment% variables inside strings, e.g., "The temp directory is: %temp%".

seg-source.mrk: <a id="ExpandEnvStrings">Changes how literal strings and % symbols are interpreted.
By default strings are treated literally, this option allows you to use %environment% variables inside strings, e.g.,

target.mrk: <a id="ExpandEnvStrings">Changes how literal strings and % symbols are interpreted.
By default strings are treated literally, this option allows you to use %environment% variables inside strings, e.g.,

trans-unit.source: Without this option the usual way would be: "The temp directory is: " & EnvGet("temp")

seg-source.mrk: Without this option the usual way would be:

target.mrk: Without this option the usual way would be:

trans-unit.source: <a id="ExpandVarStrings">Changes how literal strings and variable/macro ($ and @) symbols are interpreted. By default strings are treated literally, this option allows you to use variables and macros inside strings, e.g., "The value of var1 is $var1$".

seg-source.mrk: <a id="ExpandVarStrings">Changes how literal strings and variable/macro ($ and @) symbols are interpreted.
By default strings are treated literally, this option allows you to use variables and macros inside strings, e.g.,

target.mrk: <a id="ExpandVarStrings">Changes how literal strings and variable/macro ($ and @) symbols are interpreted.
By default strings are treated literally, this option allows you to use variables and macros inside strings, e.g.,

trans-unit.source: <a id="GUICloseOnESC">When ESC is pressed on a GUI the $GUI_EVENT_CLOSE message is sent. This option toggles this behavior on and off.

seg-source.mrk: <a id="GUICloseOnESC">When ESC is pressed on a GUI the $GUI_EVENT_CLOSE message is sent.
This option toggles this behavior on and off.

target.mrk: <a id="GUICloseOnESC">When ESC is pressed on a GUI the $GUI_EVENT_CLOSE message is sent.
This option toggles this behavior on and off.

trans-unit.source: 0 = Don't send the $GUI_EVENT_CLOSE message when ESC is pressed.

seg-source.mrk: 0 = Don't send the $GUI_EVENT_CLOSE message when ESC is pressed.

target.mrk: 0 = Don't send the $GUI_EVENT_CLOSE message when ESC is pressed.

trans-unit.source: 1 = (default) Send() the $GUI_EVENT_CLOSE message when ESC is pressed.

seg-source.mrk: 1 = (default) Send() the $GUI_EVENT_CLOSE message when ESC is pressed.

target.mrk: 1 = (default) Send() the $GUI_EVENT_CLOSE message when ESC is pressed.

trans-unit.source: Alters the position of a control defined by GUICtrlSetPos().

seg-source.mrk: Alters the position of a control defined by GUICtrlSetPos().

target.mrk: Alters the position of a control defined by GUICtrlSetPos().

trans-unit.source: 0 = relative position to the start of the last control (upper left corner).

seg-source.mrk: 0 = relative position to the start of the last control (upper left corner).

target.mrk: 0 = relative position to the start of the last control (upper left corner).

trans-unit.source: 1 = (default) absolute coordinates still relative to the dialog box.

seg-source.mrk: 1 = (default) absolute coordinates still relative to the dialog box.

target.mrk: 1 = (default) absolute coordinates still relative to the dialog box.

trans-unit.source: 2 = cell positioning relative to current cell. A -1 for left or top parameter don't increment the start.

seg-source.mrk: 2 = cell positioning relative to current cell.
A -1 for left or top parameter don't increment the start.

target.mrk: 2 = cell positioning relative to current cell.
A -1 for left or top parameter don't increment the start.

trans-unit.source: So next line is -1, offset; next cell is offset,-1; current cell is -1,-1.

seg-source.mrk: So next line is -1, offset; next cell is offset,-1; current cell is -1,-1.

target.mrk: So next line is -1, offset; next cell is offset,-1; current cell is -1,-1.

trans-unit.source: Obviously "offset" cannot be -1 which reserved to indicate the no increment. But if you can use a multiple of the width you choose to skip or go back.

seg-source.mrk: Obviously "offset" cannot be -1 which reserved to indicate the no increment.
But if you can use a multiple of the width you choose to skip or go back.

target.mrk: Obviously "offset" cannot be -1 which reserved to indicate the no increment.
But if you can use a multiple of the width you choose to skip or go back.

trans-unit.source: Define the character which delimits subitems in GUICtrlSetData().

target.mrk: Define the character which delimits subitems in GUICtrlSetData().

trans-unit.source: <a id="GUIResizeMode">Change default resizing for a control.

seg-source.mrk: <a id="GUIResizeMode">Change default resizing for a control.

target.mrk: <a id="GUIResizeMode">Change default resizing for a control.

trans-unit.source: <a id="GUIEventOptions">Change special event behavior or GUI function return values.

seg-source.mrk: <a id="GUIEventOptions">Change special event behavior or GUI function return values.

target.mrk: <a id="GUIEventOptions">Change special event behavior or GUI function return values.

trans-unit.source: 0 = (default) Windows behavior on click on Minimize,Restore, Maximize, Resize.

seg-source.mrk: 0 = (default) Windows behavior on click on Minimize,Restore, Maximize, Resize.

target.mrk: 0 = (default) Windows behavior on click on Minimize,Restore, Maximize, Resize.

trans-unit.source: 1 = suppress windows behavior on minimize, restore or maximize click button or window resize. Just sends the notification.

seg-source.mrk: 1 = suppress windows behavior on minimize, restore or maximize click button or window resize.

target.mrk: 1 = suppress windows behavior on minimize, restore or maximize click button or window resize.

target.mrk: <a id="MouseClickDelay">Alters the length of the brief pause in between mouse clicks.

target.mrk: <a id="MouseClickDragDelay">Alters the length of the brief pause at the start and end of a mouse drag operation.

trans-unit.source: <a id="MustDeclareVars">If this option is used then all variables must be pre-declared with Local, Global or in some cases Dim before they can be used - removes the chance for misspelled variables causing bugs.

seg-source.mrk: <a id="MustDeclareVars">If this option is used then all variables must be pre-declared with Local, Global or in some cases Dim before they can be used - removes the chance for misspelled variables causing bugs.

target.mrk: <a id="MustDeclareVars">If this option is used then all variables must be pre-declared with Local, Global or in some cases Dim before they can be used - removes the chance for misspelled variables causing bugs.

trans-unit.source: 0 = (default) Variables don't need to be pre-declared

seg-source.mrk: 0 = (default) Variables don't need to be pre-declared

target.mrk: 0 = (default) Variables don't need to be pre-declared

trans-unit.source: 1 = Variables must be pre-declared. See Dim / Global / Local / Const for details on declaring variables.

seg-source.mrk: See Dim / Global / Local / Const for details on declaring variables.

target.mrk: See Dim / Global / Local / Const for details on declaring variables.

trans-unit.source: <a id="PixelCoordMode">Sets the way coords are used in the pixel functions, either absolute coords or coords relative to the window defined by hwnd (default active window):

seg-source.mrk: <a id="PixelCoordMode">Sets the way coords are used in the pixel functions, either absolute coords or coords relative to the window defined by hwnd (default active window):

target.mrk: <a id="PixelCoordMode">Sets the way coords are used in the pixel functions, either absolute coords or coords relative to the window defined by hwnd (default active window):

trans-unit.source: 0 = relative coords to the defined window

seg-source.mrk: 0 = relative coords to the defined window

target.mrk: 0 = relative coords to the defined window

trans-unit.source: 2 = relative coords to the client area of the defined window

seg-source.mrk: 2 = relative coords to the client area of the defined window

target.mrk: 2 = relative coords to the client area of the defined window

trans-unit.source: Specifies if AutoIt attaches input threads when using Send() function. When not attaching (default mode=0) detecting the state of capslock/scrolllock and numlock can be unreliable under NT4. However, when you specify attach mode=1 the Send("{... down/up}") syntax will not work and there may be problems with sending keys to "hung" windows. ControlSend() ALWAYS attaches and is not affected by this mode.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies if AutoIt attaches input threads when using Send() function.
When not attaching (default mode=0) detecting the state of capslock/scrolllock and numlock can be unreliable under NT4.
However, when you specify attach mode=1 the Send("{... down/up}") syntax will not work and there may be problems with sending keys to "hung" windows.
ControlSend() ALWAYS attaches and is not affected by this mode.

target.mrk: Specifies if AutoIt attaches input threads when using Send() function.
When not attaching (default mode=0) detecting the state of capslock/scrolllock and numlock can be unreliable under NT4.
However, when you specify attach mode=1 the Send("{... down/up}") syntax will not work and there may be problems with sending keys to "hung" windows.
ControlSend() ALWAYS attaches and is not affected by this mode.

trans-unit.source: Specifies if AutoIt should store the state of capslock before a Send() function and restore it afterwards.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies if AutoIt should store the state of capslock before a Send() function and restore it afterwards.

target.mrk: Specifies if AutoIt should store the state of capslock before a Send() function and restore it afterwards.

trans-unit.source: <a id="SendKeyDelay">Alters the length of the brief pause in between sent keystrokes. A value of 0 removes the delay completely.

seg-source.mrk: <a id="SendKeyDelay">Alters the length of the brief pause in between sent keystrokes.
A value of 0 removes the delay completely.

target.mrk: <a id="SendKeyDelay">Alters the length of the brief pause in between sent keystrokes.
A value of 0 removes the delay completely.

trans-unit.source: <a id="SendKeyDownDelay">Alters the length of time a key is held down before being released during a keystroke. For applications that take a while to register keypresses you may need to raise this value from the default. A value of 0 removes the delay completely.

seg-source.mrk: <a id="SendKeyDownDelay">Alters the length of time a key is held down before being released during a keystroke.
For applications that take a while to register keypresses you may need to raise this value from the default.
A value of 0 removes the delay completely.

target.mrk: <a id="SendKeyDownDelay">Alters the length of time a key is held down before being released during a keystroke.
For applications that take a while to register keypresses you may need to raise this value from the default.
A value of 0 removes the delay completely.

trans-unit.source: <a id="TCPTimeout">Defines the time before TCP functions stop if no communication.

seg-source.mrk: <a id="TCPTimeout">Defines the time before TCP functions stop if no communication.

target.mrk: <a id="TCPTimeout">Defines the time before TCP functions stop if no communication.

trans-unit.source: <a id="TrayAutoPause">Script pauses when click on tray icon.

seg-source.mrk: <a id="TrayAutoPause">Script pauses when click on tray icon.

target.mrk: <a id="TrayAutoPause">Script pauses when click on tray icon.

trans-unit.source: 1 = (default) pause. If there is no DefaultMenu no pause will occurs.

seg-source.mrk: If there is no DefaultMenu no pause will occurs.

target.mrk: If there is no DefaultMenu no pause will occurs.

trans-unit.source: <a id="TrayIconDebug">If enabled shows the current script line in the tray icon tip to help debugging.

seg-source.mrk: <a id="TrayIconDebug">If enabled shows the current script line in the tray icon tip to help debugging.

target.mrk: <a id="TrayIconDebug">If enabled shows the current script line in the tray icon tip to help debugging.

trans-unit.source: <a id="TrayIconHide">Hides the AutoIt tray icon. Note: The icon will still initially appear for ~750 milliseconds.

seg-source.mrk: The icon will still initially appear for ~750 milliseconds.

target.mrk: The icon will still initially appear for ~750 milliseconds.

trans-unit.source: <a id="TrayMenuMode">Extend the behaviour of the script tray icon/menu. This can be done with a combination (adding) of the following values.

seg-source.mrk: <a id="TrayMenuMode">Extend the behaviour of the script tray icon/menu.
This can be done with a combination (adding) of the following values.

target.mrk: <a id="TrayMenuMode">Extend the behaviour of the script tray icon/menu.
This can be done with a combination (adding) of the following values.

trans-unit.source: 0 = (default) default menu items (Script Paused/Exit) are appended to the usercreated menu; items will automatically be checked/unchecked when clicked; double clicking the tray icon returns the controlID of the $TRAY_DEFAULT item.

seg-source.mrk: 0 = (default) default menu items (Script Paused/Exit) are appended to the usercreated menu; items will automatically be checked/unchecked when clicked; double clicking the tray icon returns the controlID of the $TRAY_DEFAULT item.

target.mrk: 0 = (default) default menu items (Script Paused/Exit) are appended to the usercreated menu; items will automatically be checked/unchecked when clicked; double clicking the tray icon returns the controlID of the $TRAY_DEFAULT item.

trans-unit.source: 2 = items will not automatically check/uncheck when clicked

seg-source.mrk: 2 = items will not automatically check/uncheck when clicked

target.mrk: 2 = items will not automatically check/uncheck when clicked

trans-unit.source: 4 = do not return the $TRAY_DEFAULT item controlID when the tray icon is double clicked

seg-source.mrk: 4 = do not return the $TRAY_DEFAULT item controlID when the tray icon is double clicked

target.mrk: 4 = do not return the $TRAY_DEFAULT item controlID when the tray icon is double clicked

trans-unit.source: 8 = turn off auto check of radio item groups

seg-source.mrk: 8 = turn off auto check of radio item groups

target.mrk: 8 = turn off auto check of radio item groups

trans-unit.source: <a id="TrayOnEventMode">Enable/disable OnEvent functions notifications for the tray.

seg-source.mrk: <a id="TrayOnEventMode">Enable/disable OnEvent functions notifications for the tray.

target.mrk: <a id="TrayOnEventMode">Enable/disable OnEvent functions notifications for the tray.

trans-unit.source: <a id="WinDetectHiddenText">Specifies if hidden window text can be "seen" by the window matching functions.

seg-source.mrk: <a id="WinDetectHiddenText">Specifies if hidden window text can be "seen" by the window matching functions.

target.mrk: <a id="WinDetectHiddenText">Specifies if hidden window text can be "seen" by the window matching functions.

trans-unit.source: <a id="WinSearchChildren">Allows the window search routines to search child windows as well as top-level windows.

seg-source.mrk: <a id="WinSearchChildren">Allows the window search routines to search child windows as well as top-level windows.

target.mrk: <a id="WinSearchChildren">Allows the window search routines to search child windows as well as top-level windows.

trans-unit.source: <a id="WinTextMatchMode">Alters the method that is used to match window text during search operations.

seg-source.mrk: <a id="WinTextMatchMode">Alters the method that is used to match window text during search operations.

target.mrk: <a id="WinTextMatchMode">Alters the method that is used to match window text during search operations.

trans-unit.source: In quick mode AutoIt can usually only "see" dialog text, button text and the captions of some controls. In the default mode much more text can be seen (for instance the contents of the Notepad window).

seg-source.mrk: In quick mode AutoIt can usually only "see" dialog text, button text and the captions of some controls.
In the default mode much more text can be seen (for instance the contents of the Notepad window).

target.mrk: In quick mode AutoIt can usually only "see" dialog text, button text and the captions of some controls.
In the default mode much more text can be seen (for instance the contents of the Notepad window).

trans-unit.source: If you are having performance problems when performing many window searches then changing to the "quick" mode may help.

seg-source.mrk: If you are having performance problems when performing many window searches then changing to the "quick" mode may help.

target.mrk: If you are having performance problems when performing many window searches then changing to the "quick" mode may help.

trans-unit.source: <a id="WinTitleMatchMode">Alters the method that is used to match window titles during search operations.

seg-source.mrk: <a id="WinTitleMatchMode">Alters the method that is used to match window titles during search operations.

target.mrk: <a id="WinTitleMatchMode">Alters the method that is used to match window titles during search operations.

trans-unit.source: 1 = (default) Match the title from the start

seg-source.mrk: 1 = (default) Match the title from the start

target.mrk: 1 = (default) Match the title from the start

trans-unit.source: 2 = Match any substring in the title

seg-source.mrk: 2 = Match any substring in the title

target.mrk: 2 = Match any substring in the title

trans-unit.source: 4 = Advanced mode (retained for backwards compatibility only - see Window Titles & Text (Advanced))

seg-source.mrk: 4 = Advanced mode (retained for backwards compatibility only - see Window Titles & Text (Advanced))

target.mrk: 4 = Advanced mode (retained for backwards compatibility only - see Window Titles & Text (Advanced))

trans-unit.source: -1 to -4 = Case insensitive match according to the other type of match.

seg-source.mrk: -1 to -4 = Case insensitive match according to the other type of match.

target.mrk: -1 to -4 = Case insensitive match according to the other type of match.

trans-unit.source: <a id="WinWaitDelay">Alters how long a script should briefly pause after a successful window-related operation.

seg-source.mrk: <a id="WinWaitDelay">Alters how long a script should briefly pause after a successful window-related operation.

target.mrk: <a id="WinWaitDelay">Alters how long a script should briefly pause after a successful window-related operation.

trans-unit.source: copy any you want to change ;default value is listed first

seg-source.mrk: copy any you want to change ;default value is listed first

target.mrk: copy any you want to change ;default value is listed first

trans-unit.source: 0=append, 1=no default menu, 2=no automatic check, 4=menuitemID not return

seg-source.mrk: 0=append, 1=no default menu, 2=no automatic check, 4=menuitemID not return

target.mrk: 0=append, 1=no default menu, 2=no automatic check, 4=menuitemID not return
